comments.author: Porfirii
comments.body: It is surprising that Sportsbet has a 1.9 rating out of 5 in TrustPilot, but a 4.5 (4.1 user rating) in Btcgosu. I have never gambled there but I know the brand because of avatars from signature campaigns, I guess, and it seems that the reason for such a low rate in TP is that it has several scam accusations, but only there.Do you guys know what happened there? is it some kind of maneuver orchestrated by the competition, a very annoying user who was very upset about something, or is something really wrong with the casino? And OP, why is it among your top picks? I would investigate more about it myself, but taking into account that it is in red in the opening post I think that it would be interesting to clear it up in this thread.

comments.author: cafter
comments.body: Quote from: Porfirii on July 25, 2023, 10:08:41 AM--Snip--sportsbet is in my top picks, because it have all features i want in a casino, like no wager withdraw, no min deposit, low min withdrawal, and promoted by bitcointalk members,  and i had never faced any issue with this site, i don't know why it has low ratings only on trustpilot, other blogs or review website have rating of 4 or above.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Porfirii on July 25, 2023, 10:08:41 AMSurprisingly, Sportsbet has a 1.9 rating out of 5 in TrustPilot, but a 4.5 (4.1 user rating) in Btcgosu. I have never gambled there but I know the brand because of avatars from signature campaigns, I guess, and it seems that the reason for such a low rate in TP is that it has several scam accusations, but only there.Do you guys know what happened there? is it some kind of manoeuvre orchestrated by the competition, a very annoying user who was very upset about something, or is something really wrong with the casino? And OP, why is it among your top picks? I would investigate more about it myself, but taking into account that it is in red in the opening post I think that it would be interesting to clear it up in this thread.I won't argue with you on the fact that sportbet have such a low rating on trust pilot because most of the site that have such low rating on trust pilot have a great rating on other review sites,  and even on this forum,  and some other platforms that have tons of positive reviews on trust pilot how low review on other sites and forum where trust are measured by individuals in form of review from real users,  e.g such examples are casinos like 1xbit who's trust here in the forum is bad due to several resolved accusations against the casino and how there have paid little or no attention to those accusations thereby leaving players with no other choice than to leave a negative trust review for the casino. More also,  most of the rating sites have hard records of irresponsible and inaccurate rating because most of their rating scores are bought since platforms or scan casinos can easily pay their way to receive positive rating scores, I don't know how Trustpilot rates or grade their review but being the most popular dating site on the Internet,  there should be at least accuracy with public opinion and the rating should be decentralized enough to allow users reviews to count at all time. Back to the ops point of view,  seeing stake on the top list is also something that is undoubtedly true and should be a source of motivation for many of us that promote the platform here in the forum,  and from my personal experience on stake,  I can say that the casino is top notch and deserves to be at the top of the list.

comments.body: Quote from: Wiwo on July 25, 2023, 10:35:13 AMI won't argue with you on the fact that sportbet have such a low rating on trust pilot because most of the site that have such low rating on trust pilot have a great rating on other review sites,  and even on this forum,  and some other platforms that have tons of positive reviews on trust pilot how low review on other sites and forum where trust are measured by individuals in form of review from real users,  e.g such examples are casinos like 1xbit who's trust here in the forum is bad due to several resolved accusations against the casino and how there have paid little or no attention to those accusations thereby leaving players with no other choice than to leave a negative trust review for the casino. And what baffles me is the statement written in the image as shown below circled with red marker as it read "We've removed a number of fake reviews for this company", and I'm still wondering what might have been the fake reviews which trustpilot removed about 1xbit if not the series of scam allegations placed against that website as a potential scam, and yet they have done nothing or intend doing nothing about it.  Which now clearly shows that for a site to be declare either trusted or fake, one dont have to depend on a review gotten from a single website.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: www.Gambler.Casino on July 25, 2023, 11:24:06 AMI don't know why so many people like Stake Casino. I lost many times without a single withdrawal of money. Played exclusively in slots. In less popular casinos, I have more luck.Luck won't always be there for you. Being in gambling industry requires everyone to know that. If you are losing then it might not be your day; some are even having bad week or even a month. Try other gambling games or if you are into sportsbetting, try making a better analysis of the game. Or try going with the odds; there are many ways to come up with a win but ofcourse losing will always be a part of the game.I do agree with the list, these are indeed the best ones right now, in this industry. There are other platforms as well which are not mentioned but if things would be continuously good on those sites, eventually they'd be as well with players' list of platforms to engage with. Every platform can offer huge amount of rewards and bonuses but not all sites could give a quality service to their players.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: congratulations for your review site, but I confess that I see something that I think is not correct, for example in the case of stake.com in the part of the minimum withdrawal amount and the transaction fee you said that the minimum withdrawal amount would be 2$ and 20$ for bitcoin, honestly I do not know in what year or month you got this data because since I use stake.com I have always seen the minimum withdrawal amount being much below 20$, to be more precise I will give you a concrete example using a picture of my stake.com accountEOS minimum withdrawal is $1.48BTC minimum withdrawal is $5.84the only currency I see that has a lower minimum withdrawal is EOS which is 1.48$ minimum to withdraw, it seems to me that it is the lowest withdrawal amount, so I think you need to double-check the withdrawal amounts at stake and then update them on your website, this is even strange because it looks like you don't use stake.com, or is it possible that your account has these amounts and mine have different values? Honestly I see it as something unlikely to happen, in any case check it out on your stake.com account
